sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: What is the perimeter of a circle if its radius is 5 cm?
message_2:
To find the perimeter (circumference) of a circle, we use the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

In this case, the radius (r) is 5 cm. So, we plug in the value into the formula:

C = 2π(5)
C = 10π

The perimeter (circumference) of the circle is 10π cm. If you want to get an approximate value, you can use π ≈ 3.14:

C ≈ 10(3.14)
C ≈ 31.4 cm

So, the perimeter of the circle is approximately 31.4 cm.
